idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: Wildlife Management Units and subunits used by the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources
descript.purpose: For agency wildlife planning and management

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.useconst: none, but the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources provides no warranty nor accepts any responsibility or liability for any inaccurate or incomplete data associated with this file.

procstep.procdesc: Feature data was digitized using the ArcView 9.0 trace tool. Digital line graphs (DLGs) at 1:100,000 scale for streams, roads, trails, county boundaries, land ownership, and railroads were obtained from http://agrc.its.state.ut.us/ served as base layers. Sketches created from DLGs were inspected and edited at 1:8,000 scale to ensure an accurate copy. Where no DLGs were available, heads-up digitizing was performed using USGS 1:100,000 DRGs as background and reference. Topology was performed with a cluster tolerance of 3.0 meters.

Feature data was digitized using ArcView 9.0 trace tool. Digital line graphs (1:100,000) of streams, roads, trails, county lines, land ownership status, and railroads obtained from agrc.state.ut.us served as base layers. Sketches created from DLGs were inspected and edited at 1:8,000 to ensure an accurate copy. USGS 1:000,000 DRGs were also used as base layers. Where no DLGs were available, heads-up digitizing was performed using DRGs as reference. Topolgy was performed with a cluster tolerance of 3 meters.

dataqual.logic: Wildlife Management Units were determined by field biologist's best profession judgement. Feature data was digitized using 1:100,000 digital line graphs of streams, roads, trails, railroads, county lines, and land ownership status obtained from Utah agrc.state.ut.us. All polygon features, except for the bounding polygon, were check against "must not verlap" and "must not have gaps" topology rules using topology verification tools in Arcinfo 9.0, and at a cluster tolerance of 3.0 meters.
dataqual.complete: Geographic data locations were based on 1:100,000 Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) published by the Utah Automated Geographic Information Center and housed as part of the State Geographical Information Database (SGID). When no DLG was available and digitizing was necessary, screen digitizing was used with a Digital Raster Graph (DRG) of the 1:100,000 scale map as background and guide.

attracc.attraccr: Attributes are either defined by biologist and managers or software generated. Attributes defined by biologists and managers are compared to a master list for correct entries. Software generated attributes are checked against know areas to assess correctness.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

distinfo.distliab: The Utah Division of Wildlife Resources provides no warranty nor accepts any responsibility or liability for any inaccurate or incomplete data associated with this file.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Number and text used to identify subunit.
Number and text used to identify subunit
Number and text used to identify subunit.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
